The Stun Baton inflicts the Zapped status and is good for 10 charges before needing to recharge. Regains one charge per 10 seconds when plugged in. The charge can be activated wirelessly or mechanically, which takes a Minor Action.
Core Rulebook.Wireless: You gain a bonus Minor Action on a turn when you activate a charge. The stun baton recharges without being plugged in, regaining one charge per half hour of wireless-enabled time.

The Shock Gloves inflict the Zapped status and are good for 10 charges before needing to recharge. Regains one charge per 10 seconds when plugged in. The charge can be activated wirelessly or mechanically, which takes a Minor Action.
Core Rulebook.Wireless: You gain a bonus Minor Action on a turn when you activate a charge. The shock gloves regain one charge per half hour of wireless-enabled time.

Core Rulebook.Ability: Add the attacker's Reaction instead of Strength for the Attack Rating on this weapon. On a critical glitch, the wielder always resists the base damage of the weapon.
Core Rulebook.Wireless: The Monofilament Whip gains an Attack Rating increase of 2. The Monofilament Whip does not hit you on a critical glitch.

Core Rulebook.Ability: Nocking an arrow takes a Minor Action (Ready Weapon, p. 43). Bows have a rating that indicates the minimum Strength you need to use the weapon. The weapon's rating is also used to determine the damage. (Maximum rating is 14). Arrows also have ratings, and must equal or exceed that of the bow.

The injection arrow or bolt causes its base damage while also delivering a payload of one dose of a drug or toxin. A successful hit must deal at least one box of damage after the Damage Resistance test. Injection arrows and bolts come at a base rating of 8. Higher-rating models are available for heavier bows, but lower-rating models aren’t sturdy enough to deliver this heavier projectile.
Core Rulebook.Wireless: The injection can be delayed until a wireless signal is sent. The injection also doesn’t need a box of damage; it just needs at least 1 net hit.

The variable ammunition system allows a single specially designed magazine (30¥ per spare) to be loaded with different ammo types. The smartgun is used to select ammo types and cycles them to the chamber in whatever quantity is necessary and available. If there aren’t enough rounds of a particular kind, the ammo counter reads empty and the weapon stops firing.

The SM-6 has dealt with the line’s fragility issues, and once put together it has no problem operating in any capacity.
